abstract: Britain's Labour Party suspends former London Mayor Ken Livingstone for asserting Hitler supported Zionism in early 1930s; remarks exacerbate suspicion of anti-Semitic tendencies within party, putting pressure on Labour leader and Livingstone ally Jeremy Corbyn.

headline.print_headline: Labour Party Suspends Former London Mayor Over Remarks About Hitler
headline.main: Labour Party Suspends Former London Mayor Over Hitler Remarks

snippet: The suspension of Ken Livingstone came a day after Labour’s leader, Jeremy Corbyn, disciplined another party member over anti-Israel posts on social media.
lead_paragraph: The suspension of Ken Livingstone came a day after Labour’s leader, Jeremy Corbyn, disciplined another party member over anti-Israel posts on social media.
